page.title: 18EARLS BARTON-THE LAND.
page.content: The village is surrounded by agricultural land which varies between clay soil and alluvial material.Beneath lie beds of ironstone or meltwash gravel.Both commodities have been quarried extensively.The quarrying of iron ore led to the quarrying of silica but this industry is finished.Evidence of the workings exists but the overhead link to the old railway has gone.The land is being reclaimed from the old quarry for housing development.The remains of bridges from the narrow guage railway are visible; the semi- derelict land is a haven for butterflies and uncommon wild flowers. Gravel is quarried in vast quantities from the river valley and the resultant lagoons fill the valley for several miles.
